p.span: Tucumcari Elementary School will prepare students for the next level of learning through collaboration of students, families, staff, and community.

Tucumcari Middle School is continuously improving to be a Straight A school with Academics as priority one, balanced by Athletics and Activities, and driven by our Attitude and Accountability. Students are the heart of all that we do!
Tucumcari High School will provide a learning community that challenges ALL students to realize their greatest potential.

div.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "comic sans ms", sans-serif;

p.span: PUBLIC NOTICE

span.style: color: rgb(78, 78, 78); font-family: Calibri; font-size: 11pt; text-align: left;

p.span: Tucumcari Public Schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year.
The School Health Based Clinic will be moving
services for students from Tucumcari High School to Sunrise Medical Clinic starting Monday, March 30th. Please call the clinic to arrange to be seen if needed. They will still honor NO Co-pays and NO
Deductibles for students.

Beginning Monday April 6, 2020, in an effort to minimize person to person contact during this time, the Tucumcari Public Schools Mesa Cafeteria Curbside meal service will be once daily from 11:30 AM to 1:00 PM, and will be available Monday through Thursday.
Breakfast and lunch meals will be served together. Friday breakfast and lunch meals will be available on Thursday.

The district is working diligently on a Continuous Learning Plan. Your child’s teacher will get into contact with you either by phone, email or text. Our goal is to implement the learning plan on Monday April 6. Plateau is providing 60 days of free internet access that is run through by the school. If your household does not have internet services, please send us an email at
so that this service can be provided to you.
Please respect social distancing.
Please refrain from taking children to parks or playgrounds as
COVID-19 can survive on metal, glass and plastic surfaces. Stay home or have playtime outside your home or in your yards.

Many questions have been brought up regarding collecting your child’s personal items from their lockers. At this point, our goal is to keep our schools closed off to the public to have a fighting chance against the spread of COVID-19. We will keep you informed as to when it is safe enough to allow these items to be picked up.

If you need to talk to Krista Mericle, the school nurse, please contact her at (575) 403-7983 or her assistant Jessica Urioste at (575) 403-5720. They will be available Monday-Friday from 8am to 12pm and then again from 1pm to 4pm.
Any updates will be posted to our website as they become available.
Aaron McKinney
Superintendent

div.p:
Counseling Services:
Michael Gilcrest - (575) 791-9251

Andrea Clark - (575) 403-5672

span.style: line-height: 24px; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);
text-align: justify; line-height: 19.5px; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

em.span: It is the policy of the Tucumcari Public Schools not to discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, national origin, or handicap in any of its educational programs or employment practices. Inquiries regarding compliance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Educational Amendments of 1972, or Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 may be directed to the Assistant Superintendent at 700 West Amarosa Avenue, Tucumcari, NM 88401.

span.em: Tucumcari Public School receives Title I Funding from the Federal government. ESSA requires schools to make parents aware that: 1) upon request from the parent, schools will provide information regarding the professional qualifications of the student’s classroom teachers. 2) upon request from the parent, the school will provide information on each assessment required by the State and pertinent information related to these tests. This information can be requested by contacting the Principal at each school.

div.p: Mission: Tucumcari Public Schools will prepare students for successful lives.
